description: This trap is sent when more than one user is logged in with
administrative access. Only applies to CLI interface.

event.Summary: Multiple user logged in administrative access

description: This trap is sent when a broadcast storm is detected.

event.Summary: Broadcast storm detected

description: This trap is sent when a broadcast storm is no longer
detected.

event.Summary: Broadcast storm is no longer detected
Link failed
VLAN request failed

description: The VLAN-ID or other identifier referring to this VLAN.
variables.name: Q-BRIDGE-MIB::dot1qVlanIndex

description: Trap is sent when attempting to delete the last configured VLAN
or the Default VLAN.

event.Summary: Deleting last configured VLAN

description: The VLAN-ID or other identifier referring to this VLAN.
variables.name: Q-BRIDGE-MIB::dot1qVlanIndex

description: Trap is sent if there are failures in resetting VLAN
configuration to defaults.

event.Summary: Reset to default VLAN configuration failed

description: The VLAN-ID or other identifier referring to this VLAN.
variables.name: Q-BRIDGE-MIB::dot1qVlanIndex

event.Summary: VLAN $v1 restore failed

description: The VLAN-ID or other identifier referring to this VLAN.
variables.name: Q-BRIDGE-MIB::dot1qVlanIndex

event.Summary: Fan failed

description: Trap is sent when this machine is a new STP Root when there is more
than one STP instance.

event.Summary: STP instance $v1 is a new STP root

description: The MSTP instance ID.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentStpMstId

description: Trap is sent when there is a STP topology change when there is more
than one STP instance.

event.Summary: STP $v1 topology changed

description: The MSTP instance ID.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentStpMstId

event.Summary: Power supply status changed

description: Trap is sent when a user fails to authenticate via the CLI or Web
interfaces.

event.Summary: User login failed

description: Trap is sent when a user account is locked due to consecutive failed login attempts via the CLI or Web
interfaces beyond the allowed limit.

event.Summary: User account locked due to failed login attempts beyond the limit

description: Trap is sent once an interface is error disabled by DAI when the
incoming packet rate exceeded configured rate limit during a
burst-interval.

event.Summary: Interface error disabled by DAI because incoming packet rate exceeded limit

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Trap is sent when this port in this STP instance enters
loop inconsistent state upon failure to receive a BPDU.

event.Summary: STP instance $v1 in loop inconsistent state because of BPDU Rx failure

description: The MSTP instance ID.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentStpMstId

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Trap is sent when this port in this STP instance exits
loop inconsistent state upon reception of a BPDU.

event.Summary: STP instance loop $v1 inconsistent state no longer exits

description: The MSTP instance ID.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentStpMstId

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Trap is sent once an interface is error disabled by DHCP Snooping when the
incoming packet rate exceeded configured rate limit during a
burst-interval.

event.Summary: Interface error disabled by DHCP snooping because incoming packet rate exceeded limit

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Trap is sent when startup-config file exists and SSH is enabled.

event.Summary: Startup-config file exists and SSH enabled

description: IP address conflict trap signifies the reception of an ARP from
another host in the LAN that has conflicting IP address.

event.Summary: Conflicting IP address $v1 is detected (MAC: $v2)

description: The IP address on the switch reported to have a conflict with
another host's IP address.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchConflictIPAddr

description: The MAC address of the host that has an IP address conflicting
with the IP address on the switch.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchConflictMacAddr

description: Trap is sent when the total CPU utilization exceeds CPU Rising
utilization threshold over the configured Rising threshold interval.

event.Summary: CPU rising utilization threshold $v1 exceeded by the process $v2

description: The CPU Rising utilization threshold in percentage. A zero percent
threshold indicates CPU Utilization Notification feature is disabled.
A notification is triggered when the total CPU utilization exceeds this
threshold over the configured Rising threshold interval.
If the Rising threshold is configured to be less than the Falling threshold,
the Falling threshold is set equal to the Rising threshold.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchCpuProcessRisingThreshold

description: Name of the process
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchCpuProcessName

description: Trap is sent when the total CPU utilization falls below CPU Falling
utilization threshold over the configured falling threshold interval.

event.Summary: CPU falling utilization threshold $v1 exceeded

description: The CPU Falling utilization threshold in percentage. Configuration of this
object value is optional. Value '0' is not allowed for configuration,
if the Rising threshold is non-zero. If the Falling threshold is configured
to be greater than the Rising threshold, the Rising threshold is set equal
to the Falling threshold. If the Falling threshold is not configured,
it takes the same value as the Rising threshold.
A notification is triggered when the total CPU utilization
falls below this threshold over the configured Falling threshold interval.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchCpuProcessFallingThreshold

description: Trap is sent when CPU Free Memory falls below the configured threshold.

event.Summary: CPU free memory less than $v1 KB

description: The CPU Free Memory threshold in kilobytes. A zero threshold value
indicates the CPU Free Memory Notification feature is disabled.
Notifications are triggered when the CPU Free Memory falls below the
configured threshold and when it rises to 10% above the configured threshold.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchCpuProcessFreeMemoryThreshold

description: Trap is sent when CPU Free Memory rises to 10% above the configured threshold.

event.Summary: CPU free memory is 10% above the threshold

description: The CPU Free Memory threshold in kilobytes. A zero threshold value
indicates the CPU Free Memory Notification feature is disabled.
Notifications are triggered when the CPU Free Memory falls below the
configured threshold and when it rises to 10% above the configured threshold.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchCpuProcessFreeMemoryThreshold

description: Trap is sent once an interface gets a Topology change event
on a port.

event.Summary: Interface topology changed on port

description: The MSTP instance ID.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentStpMstId

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Trap is sent once when switch STP detects a loop

event.Summary: Loop detected on STP

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Trap is sent when the Mbuf utilization exceeds Rising
utilization threshold.

event.Summary: Message buffer utilization is above rising threshold ($v2 %)

description: The Mbuf utilization rising threshold in percentage.
A single notification (rising event) is generated when
the total Mbuf utilization exceeds this threshold.
After a rising event is generated, another such event
will not be generated until the total Mbuf utilization
falls below the agentSwitchMbufFallingThreshold and then
exceeds the agentSwitchMbufRisingThreshold.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufRisingThreshold

description: Total number of message buffers in the system.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufsTotal

description: Number of message buffers currently in use.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufsUsed

description: Number of message buffers currently available.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufsFree

description: Trap is sent when the Mbuf utilization falls below Falling
utilization threshold.

event.Summary: Message buffer utilization is below falling threshold ($v2 %)

description: The Mbuf utilization falling threshold in percentage.
A single notification (falling event) is generated when
the total Mbuf utilization falls below this threshold.
After a falling event is generated, another such event
will not be generated until the total Mbuf utilization
exceeds the agentSwitchMbufRisingThreshold and then falls
below the agentSwitchMbufFallingThreshold.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufFallingThreshold

description: Total number of message buffers in the system.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufsTotal

description: Number of message buffers currently in use.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufsUsed

description: Number of message buffers currently available.
variables.name: EdgeSwitch-SWITCHING-MIB::agentSwitchMbufsFree
